body_html:
@apaszke @fmassa For the hiding comment you made, I think this can be thought as a bug. We need to use cartesian_prod both by torch.cartesian_prod on python, and by at::cartesian_prod in ATen. There is no reason to hide this in C++. I have fixed that issue.

We have the same problem for torch.unique: In python, it is torch.unique; but in ATen, it is at::_unique and at::_unique_dim, which is not a good API. This is fixed in: #12064
body_text:
@apaszke @fmassa For the hiding comment you made, I think this can be thought as a bug. We need to use cartesian_prod both by torch.cartesian_prod on python, and by at::cartesian_prod in ATen. There is no reason to hide this in C++. I have fixed that issue.
We have the same problem for torch.unique: In python, it is torch.unique; but in ATen, it is at::_unique and at::_unique_dim, which is not a good API. This is fixed in: #12064
body:
@apaszke @fmassa For the hiding comment you made, I think this can be thought as a bug. We need to use `cartesian_prod` both by `torch.cartesian_prod` on python, and by `at::cartesian_prod` in ATen. There is no reason to hide this in C++. I have fixed that issue.

We have the same problem for `torch.unique`: In python, it is `torch.unique`; but in ATen, it is `at::_unique` and `at::_unique_dim`, which is not a good API. This is fixed in: https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/12064
